intro: Acer wilsonii var. kwangtungense, commonly known as the Kwangtung maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern China. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, which turn vibrant red to orange in the fall. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and has a broad, spreading crown. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, appearing in clusters before the leaves emerge in spring. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
